name: Focaccia Genovese
description: Traditional Ligurian focaccia with characteristic dimpled surface, generous olive oil, and coarse salt. Soft, airy interior with golden, crispy crust.
instructions: Dissolve yeast in water (18-20°C).
Add small portion of flour and mix well.
Add malt and remaining flour, mix until all flour is hydrated.
Add salt and oil, mix well.
Cover and rest for 10 minutes.
Fold the dough to give more structure and shape into a ball.
Cover and let rest for 30 minutes.
Divide dough into 2 portions.
Make some folds on each portion to strengthen.
Cover and let rest another 30 minutes.
Use a rolling pin to flatten both portions, using flour to prevent sticking.
Oil two baking pans and place flattened dough on the trays.
Let rest for 1 hour 30 minutes. During this time, adjust dough to fit the pans.
Prepare salamoia: mix 120g water with 60g olive oil and 6g salt.
Dimple the surface deeply with fingertips.
Spray salamoia evenly over both trays, ensuring oil and water go into all the holes.
Bake at 260°C (500°F) for 20-25 minutes until golden brown.

name: Same Day Pizza - 8 Hours
description: Same day pizza with 8 hours fermentation. 70% hydration for a nice, extensible dough.
instructions: Dissolve salt in water (18-20°C).
Add small portion of flour, then yeast. Mix well.
Add remaining flour and mix until all flour is hydrated.
Cover and rest for 10 minutes.
Give 3 quick kneadings with 2 10-minute rests in between.
Let dough rest for 75-90 minutes at room temperature (20-23°C).
Cut into pizza balls (280-320g each) and shape.
Let balls rest for about 6 hours at room temperature.
Shape pizza and bake at 240-250°C (465-480°F).

name: Same Day Quick Pizza
description: Quick same day pizza with 6-7 hours fermentation. 70% hydration with warm water for faster fermentation.
instructions: Dissolve salt in warm water (38°C / 100°F).
Add small portion of flour, then yeast. Mix well.
Add remaining flour and mix until all flour is hydrated.
Cover and rest for 10 minutes.
Give 3 quick kneadings with 2 10-minute rests in between.
Let dough rest for about 90 minutes at room temperature (20-23°C).
Cut into pizza balls (280g each) and shape.
Let balls rest for about 5 hours at room temperature.
Shape pizza and bake at 240-250°C (465-480°F).

name: Extended Fermentation Pizza
description: Extended fermentation pizza (24-48 hours). 70% hydration with cold fermentation for maximum flavor and digestibility.
instructions: Dissolve salt in water (18-20°C).
Add small portion of flour, then yeast. Mix well.
Add remaining flour and mix until all flour is hydrated.
Cover and rest for 10 minutes.
Give 4 quick kneadings with 3 10-minute rests in between.
Let dough rest for about 60 minutes at room temperature (20-23°C).
Cut into pizza balls (280g each) and shape.
Place balls in fridge (5°C) for at least 20-24 hours, up to 48 hours.
Remove from fridge 1 hour before baking.
Shape pizza and bake at 240-250°C (465-480°F).

name: Pizza with Poolish
description: Pizza with poolish pre-ferment (12-14 hours). 75% hydration with minimal yeast for exceptional flavor and open crumb.

ingredients.name: Instant Dry Yeast (for poolish, or 0.49g Fresh Yeast)

instructions: POOLISH (evening before): Mix tepid water (27°C) with yeast, add flour. Cover and rest 12-14 hours at room temperature (18-21°C).
FINAL DOUGH (next day): Check poolish is well fermented and tripled in volume.
Mix salt into flour. Add warm water (41°C) to poolish and mix to partially dissolve gluten.
Add flour/salt mixture to poolish and mix until all flour is hydrated.
Cover and rest for 10 minutes.
Give 3 quick kneadings with 2 10-minute rests. Use oil as lubricant (dough is very soft and sticky).
After last kneading, rest 20 minutes, then do 2 stretch and folds with 20-minute rest between.
Let dough rest at room temperature for about 6 hours (should expand 2-2.5x).
Cut into pizza balls (280g each) and shape.
Rest balls 30 minutes, then refrigerate 30 minutes before baking.
Shape pizza and bake at 240-250°C (465-480°F).

name: Focaccia - Direct Method
description: Classic focaccia with cold fermentation. 78% hydration for a soft, airy texture with olive oil.
instructions: Mix cold water (13°C) with yeast until dissolved.
Add flour and mix until all flour is hydrated.
Cover and rest for 10 minutes.
Add salt and olive oil, mix well.
Give 3-4 quick kneadings with 10-minute rests in between.
Let dough rest for 1 hour at room temperature.
Transfer to oiled pan and refrigerate for 12-24 hours.
Remove from fridge 2 hours before baking.
Dimple the dough, add toppings and olive oil.
Bake at 220-230°C (430-450°F) for 20-25 minutes.

name: Focaccia with Poolish - 1st Method
description: Focaccia with poolish pre-ferment (12-14 hours). 70% hydration with minimal yeast for enhanced flavor.

ingredients.name: Instant Dry Yeast (for poolish, or 0.5g Fresh Yeast)

instructions: POOLISH (evening before): Mix tepid water (27°C) with yeast, add flour. Cover and rest 12-14 hours at room temperature (18-21°C).
FINAL DOUGH (next day): Check poolish is well fermented and tripled in volume.
Add warm water (39-41°C) to poolish and mix to partially dissolve gluten.
Mix salt into flour, then add to poolish mixture. Mix until all flour is hydrated.
Cover and rest for 10 minutes.
Give 3-4 quick kneadings with 10-minute rests in between.
Let dough rest at room temperature for 4-6 hours (should expand 2-2.5x).
Transfer to oiled pan, dimple the dough.
Optional: refrigerate for better flavor, remove 2 hours before baking.
Add toppings and olive oil.
Bake at 220-230°C (430-450°F) for 20-25 minutes.

name: Focaccia with Poolish - 2nd Method
description: Focaccia with cold-fermented poolish. 74% hydration with olive oil in final dough for rich flavor.

ingredients.name: Instant Dry Yeast (for poolish, or 3.2g Fresh Yeast)
Instant Dry Yeast (final dough, or 3.3g Fresh Yeast)

instructions: POOLISH (day before): Mix water (18-20°C) with yeast, add flour. Cover and refrigerate for 12-24 hours.
FINAL DOUGH (next day): Remove poolish from fridge 1 hour before using.
Add tepid water (27-30°C) to poolish and mix to partially dissolve gluten.
Mix salt into flour, then add to poolish mixture with olive oil and yeast. Mix until all flour is hydrated.
Cover and rest for 10 minutes.
Give 3-4 quick kneadings with 10-minute rests in between.
Let dough rest at room temperature for 3-4 hours.
Transfer to oiled pan, dimple the dough.
Add toppings and olive oil.
Bake at 220-230°C (430-450°F) for 20-25 minutes.

name: Basic Tomato Sauce
description: Simple tomato sauce for pizza. Blend briefly - sauce should be rough, not too liquid.
instructions: Put canned peeled tomatoes in blender bowl.
Blend very briefly - sauce should be rough and not too mixed (could become too liquid).
Add extra virgin olive oil, a dash of salt, and dried oregano and/or fresh basil leaves.
If you like it hot, add some chili pepper flakes.
Do not cook the sauce in advance - it will cook together with the pizza when it bakes.
Alternative traditional method: squeeze the tomatoes with your hands instead of using a blender.

name: Pizza Margherita
description: Classic Neapolitan pizza with tomato sauce, mozzarella fiordilatte, and fresh basil.
instructions: Prepare Basic Tomato Sauce (see recipe).
Cut mozzarella fiordilatte into small cubes or strips in a bowl and let drain.
Have fresh basil leaves ready for final finishing.
Place stretched pizza dough on well-floured work surface.
Spread 60-80g tomato sauce from center in spiral motion towards outer rim (leave cornicione).
Sprinkle a bit of grated Parmesan cheese on the sauce.
Add mozzarella fiordilatte pieces (80-100g).
Drizzle small quantity of extra virgin olive oil on pizza surface and around rim.
Transfer to pizza peel and bake at 240-250°C (465-480°F) for 6-7 minutes.
Add fresh basil leaves after baking and serve immediately.

name: Pizza Margherita with Buffalo Mozzarella
description: Classic Margherita with buffalo mozzarella added after baking for enhanced flavor.
instructions: Prepare Basic Tomato Sauce (see recipe).
Cut buffalo mozzarella into small cubes or strips and let drain.
Place stretched pizza dough on well-floured work surface.
Spread 60-80g tomato sauce from center in spiral motion towards outer rim.
Drizzle olive oil and bake at 240-250°C (465-480°F) for 6-7 minutes.
As soon as pizza is taken out of oven, spread buffalo mozzarella pieces (80-100g) on top.
Add fresh basil leaves and serve immediately.

name: Pizza Marinara
description: Traditional pizza with no cheese - tomato sauce, anchovies, olives, and optional capers.
instructions: Prepare Basic Tomato Sauce (see recipe).
Place stretched pizza dough on well-floured work surface.
Spread 80-100g tomato sauce from center in spiral motion towards outer rim.
Add 5-6 anchovy fillets spread around the pizza.
Add 8-10 small black olives in regular pattern.
If desired, add 6-8 salted or preserved small capers.
Add dried oregano leaves.
Drizzle extra virgin olive oil around.
Bake at 240-250°C (465-480°F) for 6-7 minutes.

name: Pizza with Prosciutto Crudo
description: Pizza with cheese base and prosciutto crudo added after baking to preserve its delicate flavor.
instructions: Use Italian Stracchino cheese (also called Crescenza) if possible, otherwise use mozzarella fiordilatte.
Place stretched pizza dough on well-floured work surface.
Spread 130-150g Stracchino or mozzarella on the pizza.
Drizzle olive oil and bake at 240-250°C (465-480°F) for 6-7 minutes.
When baked, cover pizza with 3-5 thin slices of Prosciutto Crudo.
The prosciutto will only get warm but will not cook.
Serve immediately.

name: Pizza with Prosciutto Crudo and Mushrooms
description: Pizza with cheese, sautéed mushrooms, and prosciutto crudo added after baking.
instructions: Clean and stir-fry 100-120g champignon mushrooms in pan with olive oil, garlic clove, salt, and optional chili flakes.
Cook mushrooms until done (or almost done), then let cool.
Place stretched pizza dough on well-floured work surface.
Spread 130-150g Stracchino or mozzarella on pizza.
Add cooked mushrooms on top.
Drizzle olive oil and bake at 240-250°C (465-480°F) for 6-7 minutes.
When ready, place 3-5 slices of Prosciutto Crudo on top.
Serve immediately.

name: Pizza with Prosciutto Cotto and Mozzarella
description: Pizza with cooked ham (prosciutto cotto), mozzarella, and black olives.
instructions: Place stretched pizza dough on well-floured work surface.
Cover pizza with 3-5 slices of Prosciutto Cotto (Italian cooked ham).
Place 100-120g mozzarella pieces on top.
Add 10-12 small black olives.
Sprinkle with dried oregano leaves.
Drizzle extra virgin olive oil all around.
Bake at 240-250°C (465-480°F) for 6-7 minutes.

name: Pizza with Zucchini and Speck
description: Pizza with sautéed zucchini, speck strips, and Parmesan cheese.
instructions: Cut 3-5 young green zucchini (15-20cm long) in small round slices (3-4mm thick) or small strips.
Stir-fry in non-stick pan with olive oil, garlic clove, and optional chili flakes until light brown.
Let cool.
Cut speck slice (1.5cm thick) into small strips (2-3mm wide).
Place stretched pizza dough on well-floured work surface.
Put zucchini on pizza.
Sprinkle with 30-40g grated Parmesan cheese.
Spread 60-80g speck strips all around.
Drizzle with olive oil and bake at 240-250°C (465-480°F) for 6-7 minutes.

name: Pizza with Broccoli and Mushrooms
description: Pizza with sautéed broccoli, mushrooms, and mozzarella or stracchino cheese.
instructions: Clean broccoli and stir-fry in deep pan with olive oil, covering with lid when not stirring.
Sprinkle salt and optional chili flakes. Let cool.
Clean and stir-fry 100-120g mushrooms in same pan until cooked. Let cool.
Place stretched pizza dough on well-floured work surface.
Place 100-120g mozzarella or stracchino cut in small pieces on pizza.
Add 200-250g broccoli and mushrooms.
Drizzle with olive oil and bake at 240-250°C (465-480°F) for 6-7 minutes.

name: Pizza with Mortadella and Pistachios
description: Pizza with mozzarella or stracchino, mortadella slices, and crushed pistachios added after baking.
instructions: Place stretched pizza dough on well-floured work surface.
Spread 100-120g mozzarella or stracchino cheese cut in small cubes or thin strips.
Drizzle olive oil and bake at 240-250°C (465-480°F) for 6-7 minutes.
When baked, lay 100-120g mortadella slices on top.
Sprinkle 15-20g crushed pistachios on top.
Serve immediately.

name: Focaccia with Green Olives
description: Simple focaccia topped with green olives, coarse sea salt, and olive oil.
instructions: When almost ready to bake, place several green olives into the dough at roughly regular intervals.
Push olives slightly into dough so they stay in place.
Sprinkle coarse sea salt on the focaccia.
Drizzle extra virgin olive oil over the top.
Bake at 220-230°C (430-450°F) for 20-25 minutes.

name: Focaccia with Cherry Tomatoes and Black Olives
description: Focaccia topped with cherry tomatoes, black olives, oregano, and olive oil.
instructions: Cut 6-8 cherry tomatoes in half.
Place tomato halves on focaccia top, pushing slightly so they stay in place when baking.
Add several black olives.
Sprinkle dried oregano leaves.
Drizzle extra virgin olive oil over the top.
Bake at 220-230°C (430-450°F) for 20-25 minutes.

name: Focaccia with Rosemary and Black Olives
description: Classic focaccia with fresh rosemary, black olives, and olive oil.
instructions: Take a fresh rosemary twig and pluck out the small leaves.
Sprinkle rosemary leaves on the focaccia top.
Place several black olives on the focaccia.
Drizzle extra virgin olive oil over the top.
Bake at 220-230°C (430-450°F) for 20-25 minutes.

name: Pizza Focaccia
description: Focaccia with pizza-style topping - tomato sauce, mozzarella, and basil (like Pizza Margherita).
instructions: Spread tomato sauce on top of focaccia dough.
Add mozzarella cut in thin round slices or thin strips.
Add fresh basil leaves.
Drizzle with extra virgin olive oil.
Bake at 220-230°C (430-450°F) for 20-25 minutes.

name: Baguette - Direct Method
description: Classic French baguette with direct method and extended cold fermentation. 75% hydration for a crispy crust and open crumb.
instructions: DAY BEFORE: Dissolve yeast in water, add half the flour and mix.
Add remaining flour and mix until all flour is hydrated.
Sprinkle salt on top, pour 50g set-aside water over it. Rest 10 minutes.
Wet hand, lift and stretch dough several times. Rest 10 minutes.
Repeat quick kneading 2-3 times until smooth. Rest 20 minutes.
Do 3 stretch and folds with 20-minute rests between each.
Put bowl in fridge for 18-24 hours.
BAKING DAY: Check fermentation - dough should almost double.
Cut dough into 250-300g pieces for each baguette.
Rest pieces 10 minutes covered.
Shape into baguettes (see shaping instructions).
Final proof 45-60 minutes until just under double.
Score and bake at 215-220°C (420-430°F) static or 200-205°C (390-400°F) fan.

name: Baguette with Poolish
description: Light and attractive baguette using poolish pre-ferment. 70% hydration with overnight cold fermentation for exceptional flavor.

ingredients.name: Instant Dry Yeast (for poolish, or 3.0g Fresh Yeast)
Instant Dry Yeast (final dough, or 13.0g Fresh Yeast)

instructions: POOLISH (evening before): Mix water with yeast, add flours. Cover and refrigerate 12-18 hours.
FINAL DOUGH: Pour water into poolish, mix to break up gluten strands.
Add yeast and flour, stir until flour is hydrated.
Sprinkle salt on top, pour remaining 50g water. Rest 10 minutes.
Wet hand, lift and stretch dough several times. Rest 10 minutes.
Repeat quick kneading 2-3 times until smooth. Last rest 20 minutes.
Do 3 stretch and folds with 20-minute rests between each.
After last fold, rest 1 hour until doubled.
Cut dough into 250-300g pieces for each baguette.
Rest pieces 10 minutes covered.
Shape into baguettes.
Final proof 45-60 minutes until just under double.
Preheat oven to 230°C (445°F) static or 210°C (410°F) fan.
Slash 4-5 diagonal cuts per baguette.
Spray water for steam, bake 25-30 minutes.

name: White Bread with Poolish
description: Versatile white bread with poolish pre-ferment. 75% hydration for soft texture and interesting flavor.
instructions: POOLISH (12-16h before): Mix tepid water with yeast, add flour. Cover and rest at room temp 12-16 hours.
Check poolish - should be doubled with small bubbles visible.
FINAL DOUGH: Pour water into poolish, mix to break up gluten strands.
Add yeast and flour, stir until flour is hydrated.
Sprinkle salt on top, pour remaining 50g water. Cover.
Do 4 quick kneadings with 3 10-minute rests, then 20-minute rest.
Do 3 stretch and folds with 2 20-minute rests between.
Rest 60-90 minutes until doubled.
Cut into 4 pieces of 440g each (or 2×880g or 6×290g).
Rest pieces 10 minutes covered.
Shape into round loaves (boule) or batard.
Final proof 45-60 minutes until just under double.
Preheat oven to 230°C (445°F) static or 210°C (410°F) fan.
Slash loaves before baking.
Spray water for steam when inserting into oven.

name: Ciabatta with Biga
description: Classic Italian ciabatta with biga pre-ferment. 67% hydration with olive oil for characteristic open crumb and crispy crust.

ingredients.name: Instant Dry Yeast (for biga, or 2.5g Fresh Yeast)
Instant Dry Yeast (final dough, or 12.0g Fresh Yeast)

instructions: BIGA (day before): Mix water with yeast, add flour. Cover and refrigerate 12-18 hours.
FINAL DOUGH: Pour water into biga, mix to break up gluten strands.
Add yeast and flour, stir until flour is hydrated.
Sprinkle salt on top, add olive oil. Rest 10 minutes.
Do 3-4 quick kneadings with 10-minute rests until smooth.
Do 3 stretch and folds with 20-minute rests between each.
Rest 60-90 minutes until doubled.
Turn out onto floured surface, shape into ciabatta loaves.
Cut into 3 pieces of approximately 580g each.
Final proof 45-60 minutes until just under double.
Preheat oven to 220°C (430°F) static or 205°C (400°F) fan.
Bake 30-35 minutes until golden and crispy.
Spray water for steam when inserting into oven.

name: Ciabatta with Poolish
description: Italian ciabatta with poolish pre-ferment. 74% hydration with olive oil for light, airy texture and characteristic holes.

ingredients.name: Instant Dry Yeast (for poolish, or 5.0g Fresh Yeast)
Instant Dry Yeast (final dough, or 10.0g Fresh Yeast)

instructions: POOLISH (day before): Mix water with yeast, add flour. Cover and refrigerate 17-24 hours.
Check poolish - should be bubbly and well fermented.
FINAL DOUGH: Pour lukewarm water into poolish, sprinkle yeast, mix to break up gluten strands.
Add flour, stir until flour is hydrated.
Sprinkle salt and pour oil on top, add remaining 50g water. Rest 10 minutes.
Do 3 quick kneadings with 2 10-minute rests between.
Do 3 stretch and folds with 2 20-minute rests between.
Rest 60-90 minutes until doubled.
Turn out onto floured surface, spread into rectangle.
Cut into 6 pieces of 280-300g each.
Rest pieces 10 minutes covered.
Shape each piece: spread into rectangle, fold in thirds.
Final proof 45-60 minutes until just under double.
Preheat oven to 220°C (430°F) static or 205°C (400°F) fan.
Bake 25-30 minutes until golden.
Spray water for steam when inserting into oven.
